description: John Lennon, a legendary musician and member of the Beatles, was born in Liverpool in 1940. He wrote iconic songs like 'Imagine' and 'Give Peace a Chance,' advocating for peace and love. Lennon's life was tragically ended when he was shot in New York City in 1980, leaving behind a lasting legacy in music and activism

The Eiffel Tower, located in Paris, France, is an iconic symbol of the city. Built by Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 World's Fair, it stands as a marvel of engineering and architecture. The tower attracts millions of visitors annually, offering breathtaking views of Paris from its observation decks. Standing at 324 meters tall, the Eiffel Tower was the tallest man-made structure in the world until 1930. Today, it remains one of the most visited landmarks globally.
